channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16631] Extract AsyncRequestFuture related code from AsyncProcess
item.description:
Now, AsyncProcess class is too large (over 2000+ lines), and there are so many sub classes in it.

AsyncRequestFutureImpl is the biggest subclass in AP, we could extract it out from AP to reduce the AP size.
item.summary: Extract AsyncRequestFuture related code from AsyncProcess

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: With this patch, AsyncProcess has 966 lines, and AsyncRequestFutureImpl has 1290 lines.
wdyt? stack

Is this a straight extraction or did you make other changes? If so, patch LGTM. We'll probably want to change our Future to subclass CompletableFuture but that can come later. I like that you keep the implementations package private.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
There is no logic changed, just split the AP and a little changes about function scope.

We'll probably want to change our Future to subclass CompletableFuture but that can come later.

Any issue about it? I also have some plan to refactor AP, for example, unify submit and submitAll, not sure what is your plan.
retry

OK. +1

I have no plan. Ijust thinking about what our asynchronous client API will be and that it and here in AP align. Later

Why TestAsyncProcess not be triggered in QA? Do you know the reason? stack
Is it in the set of flakey tests?

Not in flakey tests. Very weird, it seems everything looks good in https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3547/artifact/patchprocess/patch-unit-hbase-client.txt, but there is no TestAsyncProcess.....

Says


[INFO] --- maven-surefire-plugin:2.18.1:test (secondPartTestsExecution) @ hbase-client ---

[INFO] Tests are skipped.

TestAsyncProcess is
@Category(

{ClientTests.class, MediumTests.class}

)

... Not sure why it'd skip second part when it looks like first part all passed fine.

Retry and if still failing, we need to dig in

Notice this: hbase-client/pom.xml


 <executions>

          <execution>

            <id>secondPartTestsExecution</id>

            <phase>test</phase>

            <goals>

              <goal>test</goal>

            </goals>

            <configuration>

              <skip>true</skip>

            </configuration>

          </execution>

        </executions>

Let me change the skip to be false, and retry
v2 trigger the secondaryPart tests in hbase-client/pom.xml
Did that change recently?

-1 overall

It is not changed recently, last change for this part is HBASE-8187.

But I notice QA could trigger secondaryPart now https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3562/artifact/patchprocess/patch-unit-hbase-client.txt
Timeout test case could pass locally, commit with hbase-client/pom.xml changed (patch v3)? wdyt? stack
I want to know if that setting changed recently? I am wondering if it is being set in a profile or via cmd line up on build box.

QA use the 'runAllTests' profile. And it looks good to me. 


cd /testptch/hbase/hbase-client

mvn -Dmaven.repo.local=/home/jenkins/yetus-m2/hbase-master-patch-1 -DHBasePatchProcess -PrunAllTests clean test -fae

Not sure whether the cmd line is updated or not recently, let me have a check, not familiar with it...

Create one new issue for it, maybe someone has related experience. See HBASE-16641.

Meanwhile, let me go on this issue (patch v1), wdyt? stack
Get another run in to see if the failures are related at all.
+1 on v1 (minus the pom change). Yeah, good idea making a new issue. I started another run just so can see if failures are related at all (they should not be given you made no change).

-1 overall
